data.title: Our First Investment - TLV Partners and Shlomo Kramer are Leading a $4 Million A Round in Scalock
data.meta_description: They will be joined in the round by hi-tech Entrepreneurs, Michael Fey, President and COO of Blue Coat Security; Giora Yaron former Chairman of Mercury and Boaz Chalamish, former SVP and GM of VMWare . Scalock was founded in 2015 and has 10 employees.
data.text:
They will be joined in the round by hi-tech Entrepreneurs, Michael Fey, President and COO of Blue Coat Security; Giora Yaron former Chairman of Mercury and Boaz Chalamish, former SVP and GM of VMWare .

Scalock was founded in 2015 and has 10 employees. The company develops a SaaS security solutions for virtual containers (e.g. Docker). Scalock’s product provides protection and security against internal and external threats to container-based applications and micro-services, and a complete access control mechanism to monitor and enforce security for virtual containers in run-time. The company plans to use the funds raised to establishing its presence in the US.

Dror Davidoff and Amir Jerbi the founders of Scalock, are both seasoned Entrepreneurs with an extensive background in the hi-tech industry. Davidoff was the CRO at Clicktale, and EVP of Sales at Sentrigo and Cyvida. Amir was Principal Software Architect at CA Technologies and led the development of virtualization technologies and cloud environments for CA’s ControlMinder product line.

TLV Partners, is a new Israeli VC fund formed earlier this year by two of Israel’s distinguished venture capitalists, Rona Segev and Eitan Bek. Segev and Bek launched TLV Partners after working for 10 years as General Partners at Pitango. Scalock is the first investment for the newly formed Fund.

"Virtual containers are underpinning the future of the cloud infrastructure industry. In the fast evolving ecosystem surrounding virtual containers, there is a need for security solutions. Scalcok is by far the most innovative and advanced solution on the market,” says Segev.

TLV partners was formed with the vision of becoming the first choice for Israeli entrepreneurs looking for their Series A funding. “We are proud to be leading Scalock’s A-round, and to be working hand in hand with some of Israel’s leading Entrepreneurs on this exciting project,” continues Segev.
